cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest then north, crossing Florida’s Big Bend and moving northeast along the southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys through the Florida Big Bend and subsequently the Georgia–Carolina coastline
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts below tropical-storm force (generally <34 kt) possible as the system passes well to the east
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor tidal fluctuations possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rain bands, generally 1–2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would significantly disrupt port operations
